title: Climbing Up The Ladder
text: Climbing Up The Ladder United Kingdom, London, 29 September 2015 -- An upward movement is a fair indicator of a country’s global popularity. Hong Kong has already climbed two steps ahead to secure 13th position in tourism competitiveness. However, a lot is needed to maintain the position or to move ahead.In a recent survey of the competitiveness of the tourism industry in countries around the globe, Hong Kong has successfully climbed to attain the 13th position. The city scored 4.68 out of seven points. That is indeed a good score amongst 141 countries that participated in the survey. The countries were judged on the basis of 14 criteria namely their business environment, travel strategies, communication regulations, infrastructure standards and natural abundance. According to the report, Hong Kong surpassed other countries in three areas. It led in infrastructure with ideal ground and port facilities. The two other areas where the city excelled were a suitable business environment and perfect communication networking. Indications The figures of the survey clearly indicate that Hong Kong needs to diversify itself to attract tourists further. The fact that it has not secured well on cultural aspects is apparently a warning sign to the future of tourism in the city. Best recognized as a shopping destination, it needs to put in sincere efforts in other attractions and service quality in order to enhance tourism in the city. Tourism and Hong Kong The travel industry forms the backbone of Hong Kong’s economy. Being the major contributor to its GDP, the government is really keen to promote a healthy and sustainable expansion of the tourism industry. Connection Between Culture And Tourism Cultural tourism is another way to attract cheap flights to Hong Kong from UK of travelers with varying tastes and preferences. In fact, Hong Kong is one such city that has rich culture and heritage. Promoting this richness appropriately will give leverage to the city on the global map. It is believed that the city has always attracted only the shoppers and has not cared enough for other types of travelers. According to travel consultants, hosting music festivals or sport events can help draw high quality tourists to the destination, thereby increasing the extent of tourist income for the country. Attractions The rising skyline of Hong Kong is an obvious indication of its ambitions and progress. This bustling city is an entertainment house, a shopper’s paradise and an adventure spot. This is why cheap tickets to Hong Kong area available from all important destinations of the world. Some of its amazing attractions include the following:Hong Kong Disneyland: Visitors can embark on a magical journey in the seven themed lands of this Disneyland. Shining bright like a star during the night, there is perfect harmony of music and colour here. Ocean Park: This theme park features a huge variety of attractions of marine life, animals, amusement rides and shows. It is a great excursion for travelers of all ages who can watch performances of sea lions and dolphins at the Ocean Theatre. The Giant Pandas are also a great attraction. Hong Kong Museum of History: This 7,000 square metre space gives a lot of information about the culture and development of the place. It covers the full story of Hong Kong prior to Neolithic times to the present. Avenue of Stars: This sidewalk on the shore of Victoria Bay seems to pay tribute to famous movie stars from Hong Kong. Hand imprints of actors like Jackie Chan and Bruce Lee can be seen here. An impressive light and laser show known as “A Symphony of Lights” is staged every night at this place. The show has attained the status of "World's largest permanent Light and Sound Show" by the Guinness Book of World Records. With a wide range of attractions, the city never ceases to amaze its travelers. Cheap air tickets to Hong Kong from UK are available for tourists to come and explore its wonders. # # #
